title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not include an explanation that aquaporins can move laterally within (the hydrophobic region of) the plasma membrane because of the fluid nature of the plasma membrane.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not include supporting evidence that mitochondria evolved when an ancestral cell engulfed a (free-living prokaryotic) cell. Aquaporins in mitochondria are likely derived from aquaporins in (the plasma membrane of) the engulfed cell.

The response includes supporting evidence that mitochondria evolved when an ancestral cell engulfed a (free-living prokaryotic) cell. Aquaporins in mitochondria are likely derived from aquaporins in (the plasma membrane of) the engulfed cell.
